issue.title: Test the version number for semver compatibility

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

Adds a test for semver compatibility

closes: #8645 

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [ ] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: Good catch. This issue, which is a bug and didn't report this way in past Helm x.y.0 releases, has to do with the output of `helm version`.

To add more detail... this happens when Helm is compiled outside our toolchain. For example, if you download one of our binaries it's set...

```
$ wget https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz
--2020-08-24 09:17:24--  https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz
Resolving get.helm.sh... 152.195.19.97
Connecting to get.helm.sh|152.195.19.97|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 13376879 (13M) [application/x-tar]
Saving to: ‘helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz’

helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.ta 100%[========================================>]  12.76M  12.6MB/s    in 1.0s

2020-08-24 09:17:25 (12.6 MB/s) - ‘helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz’ saved [13376879/13376879]


$ tar -zxvf helm-v3.3.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz
x darwin-amd64/
x darwin-amd64/README.md
x darwin-amd64/helm
x darwin-amd64/LICENSE

$ cd darwin-amd64

$ ./helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.3.0", GitCommit:"8a4aeec08d67a7b84472007529e8097ec3742105", GitTreeState:"dirty", GoVersion:"go1.14.7"}
```

I checked homebrew and it doesn't impact that either...
```
$ /usr/local/Cellar/helm/3.3.0/bin/helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.3.0", GitCommit:"8a4aeec08d67a7b84472007529e8097ec3742105", GitTreeState:"dirty", GoVersion:"go1.14.6"}
```

This is specific self compiled outside the workflow that sets the version.
Ok, now i understand why not everyone is facing this problem. I'm using helm on Manjaro Linux from the official manjaro repository.

rename.to: "helm version" does not report patch number when compiled outside regular process

body: I changed the title to reflect the issue.

issue.title: helm: overwriting the LDFLAGS cousing helm binary to show the incorrect version information

repository.name: archlinux-pkgbuilds
repository.description: PKGBUILDs in the Arch Linux repositories

issue.body:
Current output:
```
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.3", GitCommit:"", GitTreeState:"", GoVersion:"go1.15"}
```

Should be:
```
$ helm version
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.3.0", GitCommit:"8a4aeec08d67a7b84472007529e8097ec3742105", GitTreeState:"dirty", GoVersion:"go1.15"}
```

The Problem: v3.3 is not semver comatible

Related issues:

* https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/8645
* https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/skaffold/issues/4711

body:
I've tried to resolve the issue by posting a PR to Arch repository but it was rejected:

https://github.com/Foxboron/archlinux-pkgbuilds/pull/3

The fix is incorrect and introduces other issues (it won't even build with the proposed patch).

The embedded version in helm should be semver compatible, and the fact that the correct tag isn't included when `LDFLAGS` is overwritten is the main issue.

https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/internal/version/version.go#L32

issue.title: Makefile: Fix LDFLAGS overriding

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
When distributions build software it's desriable to have the ability to
define own linker flags, or Go flags. As `-ldflags` defined in `go
build` overrides `-ldflags` defined in the env variable `GOFLAGS`, there
is a distinct need to be able to define new replace the default values
with new ones.

This patch introduces the override directive to the Makefile so we are
able to supply own LDFLAGS from the `make` invocation along with
appending any needed LDFLAGS from the Makefile.

https://ftp.gnu.org/old-gnu/Manuals/make-3.79.1/html_chapter/make_6.html#SEC66

Fixes #8645

Signed-off-by: Morten Linderud <morten@linderud.pw>

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

```bash
λ helm » make LDFLAGS="-s -w -linkmode external" GOFLAGS="-buildmode=pie -trimpath"
GO111MODULE=on go build -buildmode=pie -trimpath -tags '' -ldflags '-s -w -linkmode external -X helm.sh/helm/v3/internal/version.version=v3.3.0 -X helm.sh/helm/v3/internal/version.metadata= -X helm.sh/helm/v3/internal/version.gitCommit=8a4aeec08d67a7b84472007529e8097ec3742105 -X helm.sh/helm/v3/internal/version.gitTreeState=dirty' -o /home/fox/Git/prosjekter/Go/helm/bin/helm ./cmd/helm
```
